page.title: 18THE RIVER DOUGLAS
page.content: The{River Douglas}rises on{Rivington {Moor}to the east of Wigan and flows roughly westwards, through the town centre, to enter the{Irish Sea}north of Southport. It was a clean river providing salmon fishing up to 150 years ago. Since the{Industrial {Revolution}it has become very{polluted from chemicals discharged by paper and textile works along its course. Until recently it might have been a different colour each day from dye. The NW Water Authority finished building a large new sewer in the late 1970's and the river's condition has {improved}since. Fish now live in it again and it is no longer a dangerous eyesore. Wiganers are proud of it once more and numerous{conservation}schemes are active. These involve landscaping of the valley sides and planting trees especially in the Bottling Wood area.
